I thought, this a problem with my own setup (X11, FreeBSD, using KOI8-U fonts by default), but then saw my own "rich-text" e-mail (composed in Thunderbird) on a co-worker's screen (Thunderbird on Windows) and noticed the same problem: the fixed-font text (such as inside <tt>...</tt> tags) appears significantly smaller, than the surrounding normal (variable-width) letters.

I then realized, I've seen the same problem not just in e-mails, but also viewing web-pages. I'm providing a URL to a simple test-page -- note, how much shorter the fixed-font letters are...

Perhaps, the code could be tuned to pick a closer-matching fixed-width font for the chosen variable-width one.
